articles.headline: Potential Debt Ceiling Deal Would Barely Change Federal Spending Path
articles.snippet: Negotiators have focused on a relatively small corner of the budget, shunning new revenues or cuts to the fastest-growing programs
articles.abstract: Negotiators have focused on a relatively small corner of the budget, shunning new revenues or cuts to the fastest-growing programs
articles.lead_paragraph: As their debt limit negotiations with President Biden push the nation perilously close to a devastating default, House Republicans have stuck to a clear message: They must force a change in what they call the nation’s “unsustainable” spending path.

articles.headline: In Shaky Start, Ron DeSantis Joins 2024 Race, Hoping to Topple Trump
articles.snippet: The Florida governor, Donald Trump’s strongest challenger since 2016, made an unusual and glitch-marred entrance on Twitter alongside Elon Musk. He now faces a daunting clash with Mr. Trump and his scorched-earth tactics.
articles.abstract: The Florida governor, Donald Trump’s strongest challenger since 2016, made an unusual and glitch-marred entrance on Twitter alongside Elon Musk. He now faces a daunting clash with Mr. Trump and his scorched-earth tactics.
articles.lead_paragraph: Ron DeSantis’s long-awaited official entry into the 2024 presidential campaign went haywire at its start on Wednesday during a glitch-filled livestream over Twitter.
articles.byline: By Nicholas Nehamas and Shane Goldmacher

articles.headline: Ukrainians Were Likely Behind Kremlin Drone Attack, U.S. Officials Say
articles.snippet: American spy agencies do not know exactly who carried out the attack this month, but suggest it was part of a series of covert operations orchestrated by Ukraine’s security services.
articles.abstract: American spy agencies do not know exactly who carried out the attack this month, but suggest it was part of a series of covert operations orchestrated by Ukraine’s security services.
articles.lead_paragraph: U.S. officials said the drone attack on the Kremlin earlier this month was likely orchestrated by one of Ukraine’s special military or intelligence units, the latest in a series of covert actions against Russian targets that have unnerved the Biden administration.
articles.byline: By Julian E. Barnes, Adam Entous, Eric Schmitt and Anton Troianovski

articles.headline: With Climate Panel as a Beacon, Global Group Takes On Misinformation
articles.snippet: A group of scholars introduced an international panel to study the digital information landscape, inspired by those who had been warning of the effect of global warming.
articles.abstract: A group of scholars introduced an international panel to study the digital information landscape, inspired by those who had been warning of the effect of global warming.
articles.lead_paragraph: Two years ago, at a virtual gathering organized by the Nobel Foundation, Sheldon Himelfarb outlined the idea that the world’s leading scholars should join forces to study misinformation the way that scientists of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change documented the global effect of carbon emissions.

articles.headline: Highways Have Sliced Through City After City. Can the U.S. Undo the Damage?
articles.snippet: The Biden administration is funding projects around the country aimed at reconnecting communities that have been divided by transportation infrastructure.
articles.abstract: The Biden administration is funding projects around the country aimed at reconnecting communities that have been divided by transportation infrastructure.
articles.lead_paragraph: Anthony Roberts set out to walk to a convenience store on the opposite side of a busy highway in Kansas City, Mo., one afternoon. It wasn’t an easy trip.

articles.headline: Once a Symbol of China’s Growth, Now a Sign of a Housing Crisis
articles.snippet: Nanchang’s skyscrapers represented urban transformation, but the city added apartments faster than its population grew. The result: vacant homes and offices.
articles.abstract: Nanchang’s skyscrapers represented urban transformation, but the city added apartments faster than its population grew. The result: vacant homes and offices.
articles.lead_paragraph: The rows of towering buildings crowding the banks of the Gan River are a testament to the real estate boom that transformed Nanchang in eastern China from a gritty manufacturing hub to a modern urban center.
articles.byline: By Daisuke Wakabayashi and Claire Fu

articles.headline: A Hiring Law Blazes a Path for A.I. Regulation
articles.snippet: New York City’s pioneering, focused approach sets rules on how companies use the technology in work force decisions.
articles.abstract: New York City’s pioneering, focused approach sets rules on how companies use the technology in work force decisions.
articles.lead_paragraph: European lawmakers are finishing work on an A.I. act. The Biden administration and leaders in Congress have their plans for reining in artificial intelligence. Sam Altman, the chief executive of OpenAI, maker of the A.I. sensation ChatGPT, recommended the creation of a federal agency with oversight and licensing authority in Senate testimony last week. And the topic came up at the Group of 7 summit in Japan.

articles.headline: Reid Hoffman Is on a Mission: To Show A.I. Can Improve Humanity
articles.snippet: Few are as involved in so many different artificial intelligence efforts as Mr. Hoffman, a Silicon Valley investor who co-founded LinkedIn.
articles.abstract: Few are as involved in so many different artificial intelligence efforts as Mr. Hoffman, a Silicon Valley investor who co-founded LinkedIn.
articles.lead_paragraph: Reid Hoffman, billionaire entrepreneur and venture capital investor, is worried about artificial intelligence — but not for the doomsday reasons making headlines. Instead, he worries the doomsday headlines are too negative.

articles.headline: Russia’s Old Bombs Elude Ukraine’s Modern Defenses
articles.snippet: Ukrainian and American officials say Russian warplanes are dropping Soviet-era bombs, some modified to glide long distances, which are almost impossible to shoot down.
articles.abstract: Ukrainian and American officials say Russian warplanes are dropping Soviet-era bombs, some modified to glide long distances, which are almost impossible to shoot down.
articles.lead_paragraph: Maryna Ivanova, a young woman living in a riverside village in southern Ukraine, had an uneasy feeling when her fiancé and brother left for work one morning in early May. They were headed to a nearby island in the Dnipro River, the watery front line between Russian and Ukrainian forces, and the area was getting heavily shelled.
articles.byline: By Jeffrey Gettleman and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: The Policy Fights Where DeSantis Sees His Chance to Hit Trump
articles.snippet: Donald Trump and Ron DeSantis are staking out conflicting positions on major issues, setting up an ideological battle that will play out over the next eight months.
articles.abstract: Donald Trump and Ron DeSantis are staking out conflicting positions on major issues, setting up an ideological battle that will play out over the next eight months.
articles.lead_paragraph: Ron DeSantis is girding for battle with Donald J. Trump where he believes the former president may be most vulnerable to attack from a fellow Republican: on substance.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Swan, Maggie Haberman and Nicholas Nehamas

articles.headline: An Iconic Wine Store and the Mystery of the Missing Bottles
articles.snippet: Sherry-Lehmann, a longtime purveyor of luxury wines, owes New York State $2.8 million in unpaid sales taxes — and its customers an explanation.
articles.abstract: Sherry-Lehmann, a longtime purveyor of luxury wines, owes New York State $2.8 million in unpaid sales taxes — and its customers an explanation.
articles.lead_paragraph: New York City has spawned many iconic retailers: Tiffany & Company in jewelry; Bergdorf Goodman and Saks Fifth Avenue in fashion; F.A.O. Schwarz in toys.
